title: Possible offline League of Legends version for Military Servicemen and women
body:
Greetings,

I am a sailor in the United States Navy, and, like myself, there are many servicemen and women that would love to play the game offline, inside a ship, or during deployment, where the option to play League of Legends is limited to possibly accessing very unreliable WiFi, through coffee shops, or internet cafes. I have spent over 40+ days out to sea wishing i would be able to play the game by myself, if not just to practice, or play with friends.  I have spoken with many people, and they have said that if there was an offline version of league they could play they_** wouldn't even mind paying for it, myself included.**_


I understand that what i am asking is a very difficult task, but if there is a way us servicemen and servicewomen could play the game in remote locations throughout the world, i feel, that it would increase the amount of people playing the game. And your current fans that are active in the community would greatly appreciate the gesture.

on behalf of the gaming community in the armed forces, afloat, overseas, and domestic. Thank you for listening.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 
ABFAN Marcano Schmilinsky, Luis, E. (aka_ Skee_)
USS KEARSARGE(LHD-3)
_marcanol@lhd3.navy.mil_


NOTE: i have attached my ship's email address, because I only have unrestricted access to the internet when we are in port, at a sketchy coffee shop, running 5Kbps. That being said, if anyone from Riot is able to see this, please contact me through there. I understand I am not supposed to leave sensitive information here, but once I leave port, well, no internet.
